Quick search

readmirlog¶

This module contains functionality for getting information from miriad files.

Reference¶

apercal.subs.readmirlog.get_amps(file_)[source]¶

Function to create a python array of selfcal amplitude gains from a dataset file_ (str): u,v file with the gain calibration return(array, array): an array with the phase gains for each antenna, frequency bin and solution interval, a

datetime array with the actual solution timesteps
apercal.subs.readmirlog.get_bp(file_)[source]¶

Function to create a python array from a bandpass calibrated dataset to analyse file_ (str): u,v file with the bandpass calibration return(array, array): The bandpass array in the following order (antenna, frequencies, solution intervals) and a

list of the frequencies
apercal.subs.readmirlog.get_delays(file_)[source]¶

Function to create a numpy array with the antenna delays for each solution interval file_ (str): u,v file with the bandpass calibration return(array, array): an array with the delays for each antenna and solution interval in nsec, a datetime array

with the actual solution timesteps
apercal.subs.readmirlog.get_nants(file_)[source]¶

Funtion to get the number of antennas from a MIRIAD gain file file_ (str): the log file with the table returns (int): Number of antennas

apercal.subs.readmirlog.get_nbins(file_)[source]¶

Funtion to get the number of frequency bins in a MIRIAD gain file file_ (str): the log file with the table returns (int): Number of frequency bins

apercal.subs.readmirlog.get_ndims(file_)[source]¶

Wrapper funtion to get the dimension of the selfcal gain file file_ (str): u,v file with the gain calibration returns (int, int, int): Number of antennas, number of frequency bins, number of time intervals

apercal.subs.readmirlog.get_nsols(file_)[source]¶

Funtion to get the number of solution intervals from a MIRIAD gain file file_ (str): the log file with the table returns (int): Number of solution intervals

apercal.subs.readmirlog.get_phases(file_)[source]¶

Function to create a python array of selfcal phase gains from a dataset file_ (str): u,v file with the gain calibration return(array, array): an array with the phase gains for each antenna, frequency bin and solution interval, a

datetime array with the actual solution timesteps
apercal.subs.readmirlog.reformat_table(file_)[source]¶

Function to change the file format of a MIRIAD ggplt table to an ascii table compatible one file_ (str): the log file with the table
